stream_context.summary: Kaze spent the entire stream blocking-out and iterating on the very first overworld section of Return to Yoshi’s Island, working out player flow, gates and early tutorials.

development_findings.summary: All 15 main courses are now finished; remaining tasks are a handful of side levels, Biobak’s visual re-works, and the entire overworld.
development_findings.quote: We basically just finished course 15, which means all the main courses are done. Now, all that's remaining is some side levels, Biobak's reworks, and the overworld.

development_findings.summary: The overworld will be the full island, split into 15 visible parts; Kaze is rough-blocking every part first, then will add gameplay objects, then polish visuals.
development_findings.quote: We will be designing all 14 visible overworld parts at the same time and then afterwards we will be adjusting them.

development_findings.summary: First overworld layout: player arrives by boat at a short dock, sees a lighthouse landmark and a sleeping orange Yoshi; Course 2 entrance is visible, Course 1 (Bunny Brushwoods) is purposely locked.
development_findings.quote: The goal for the first overworld here right now is just to build intrigue… You land here and there will be an orange Yoshi here and he will be sleeping.

development_findings.summary: Course 1 will be blocked by a Pachyderm from Yoshi’s Story; Kaze is deciding between a coin toll or a ground-pound knock-over mechanic, both teaching new systems.
development_findings.quote: What if the elephants somehow blocked it and you have to get rid of the elephants… Maybe you have to find coins in the overworld and then you can pay him off to let you through or you ground-pound him.

development_findings.summary: Overworld coins act as global currency; player must be able to gather at least 10 coins in the very first area via simple platforming (palm trees, dunes, crates).
A friendly Cheep-Cheep holding a sign will spawn near the dock to teach the new swim controls (stick + A/B) without intrusive text boxes.
development_findings.quote: We could literally have a Cheep-Cheep swim up to Mario with a sign that tells you the controls.

development_findings.summary: After 2–3 stars an overworld event triggers: a message-in-a-bottle washes ashore, hinting at a secret star on the ‘lonely palm’ island, establishing that the hub changes with progress.

Camera plan: brief intro cutscene shows Mario’s boat docking, lighthouse in background, then swings behind Mario; long dock idea was discarded to reduce risk of players falling in before learning to swim.
Technical: implemented a new RNG based on the cycle-counter, producing true hardware noise; this breaks determinism and likely makes TAS playback impossible.
development_findings.quote: Every time I load a save-state it's a different one… so I think you can't test this romhack.

development_findings.summary: Coins now ‘chase’ Mario when they spawn to reduce RNG dependence in speedruns.
development_findings.quote: I made it so that coins chase Mario when they spawn… RNG is a little less impactful in this game.

development_findings.summary: Beta-testing strategy: start RTYI tests ‘pretty soon,’ possibly before overworld done; first wave gets a build with only one level to iterate quickly.
development_findings.quote: Beta testing for RTYI will probably be longer… we’re going to send people a demo with just one level in it and then we improve it over testing.

context_findings.summary: Kaze is personally funding development; Biobak’s contract alone will cost ‘tens of thousands,’ and he is considering a donation drive.
context_findings.quote: The game as a whole is going to cost me in the tens of thousands, just so you guys know.

context_findings.summary: He relies on Patreon, YouTube sponsorships, and a new editor; waiting on ad deals before releasing queued videos.
context_findings.quote: I actually have two videos already… I'm just waiting to be able to insert a sponsor. I need to pay the editor.

context_findings.summary: Expresses strong preference for elegant design over fetch-quests; dislikes RPG grind and randomizers that ‘have no gameplay design.’
context_findings.quote: I do not like developing games that I personally wouldn't enjoy.

context_findings.summary: Shows frustration with chat nitpicking unfinished art; intentionally hides some features (hat material, N64 head bug) to avoid repetitive complaints.
context_findings.quote: Whenever this feature is active people go like ‘Kaze, the head material is wrong,’ so I usually have it disabled.

biobak.summary: Re-working all level graphics; his workload is the primary cost driver.
biobak.quote: Yes, Biobak is reworking all the levels and I have to pay him a lot for that.

zeina.summary: Provides reference images for environment ideas via DM; Kaze requests her Bunny Brushwoods sketch during stream.

key_stories.title: Blocking Course 1 with Pachyderm
key_stories.summary: Kaze wants players to feel ‘stuck’ on arrival, finding Course 2 first. He experiments with using a Pachyderm enemy to guard Bunny Brushwoods, debating whether the player should pay coins or ground-pound it over.
key_stories.challenge: Give early overworld intrigue without frustrating hard locks.
key_stories.process: Prototyped coin tolls, environmental switches and finally a Pachyderm gate; weighed teaching moments (currency vs. moveset).
key_stories.outcome: Decision not final; Pachyderm concept logged for further testing.
key_stories.key_quote: What if the elephants somehow blocked it and you have to get rid of the elephants?

key_stories.title: True-Noise RNG Dilemma
key_stories.summary: A new cycle-counter RNG routine gives authentic hardware noise but ruins determinism, complicating TAS development and testing.
key_stories.challenge: Faster RNG required for performance and design but breaks tool-assisted runs.
key_stories.process: Tested on emulator and real N64; confirmed non-determinism.
key_stories.outcome: Leaning toward keeping it despite TAS issues; may require emulator changes.
key_stories.key_quote: It may be impossible to test this game… I kind of have to do it this way.

key_stories.title: Visible Lighthouse Landmark
key_stories.summary: Kaze iterates dock length and camera to ensure players immediately notice the distant lighthouse, a later overworld area.
key_stories.challenge: Create intrigue without forcing a boring, long dock walk or risky water fall.
key_stories.process: Tried extended dock, then replaced with short dock plus opening cutscene camera sweep.
key_stories.outcome: Cutscene approach adopted; lighthouse remains a motivational vista.
key_stories.key_quote: The long dock kind of sucks to walk across, so we'll show the lighthouse in the intro camera instead.

key_stories.title: Financing Biobak’s Re-works
key_stories.summary: Graphics revamp is outsourced to Biobak; cost now ‘tens of thousands.’
key_stories.challenge: High art budget vs. free ROM-hack distribution.
key_stories.process: Paying out-of-pocket; considers donation drive and merch OST cartridge.
key_stories.outcome: No funding solution yet; open to community help.
key_stories.key_quote: I hope I can make that back through donations somehow.
